author: potuz

author: tuyen4818
content: there's a lodestar-besu issue tracked in https://github.com/ChainSafe/lodestar/issues/3388, anyone from Besu available for an investigation?

author: tuyen4818
content: I opened an issue in Besu repo https://github.com/hyperledger/besu/issues/2940

author: mariusvanderwijden
content:
Just finished syncing Pithos with prysm-geth. Took 1h 27m. Started syncing with ~10 slots/s and picked up around epoch 1000 to ~35slots/s
Which was quite weird to me

author: potuz
content: Interesting I started with 20 and went down to 5 after the merge, I had to wait the whole afternoon to sync from scratch

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: 5/s is that normal? We usually sync 8 blocks/s (with 15M gas) on eth1 rn.

author: potuz
content: I blamed it on bandwidth here, but I don't know if it's an issue to look at, I'm in the same network I'm staking from and I suppose I'm geographically isolated on pithos

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: Well bandwith with full blocks will be even worse. How big are the empty eth2 blocks?

author: potuz
content: blocks are tiny, but I'm feeding hundreds of peers on mainnet

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: <@!199561711278227457> I could create some big blocks if you can send me some eth to test: 0xb02A2EdA1b317FBd16760128836B0Ac59B560e9D

author: potuz
content: oops, probably you got twice ðŸ™‚

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: Nope, I got the one from you, just saw it in the logs first ðŸ˜„

author: terencechain
content: Curious how many slots / s for syncing on other CL implementations. Prysm is currently under optimized as we disabled batch sync. Since CL has to synchronously call to EL in the current interop API spec, CL batch block validation makes less sense
